titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

div.p: They are not skilful considerers of human things who imagine to remove sin by removing the matter of sinâ€¦ Though ye take from a covetous man all his treasure, he has yet one jewel left, ye cannot bereave him of his covetousness. Banish all objects of lust, shut up all youth into the severest discipline that can be exercised in any hermitage ye cannot make them chaste that came not hither so.

body.p: Patrick Wild went off after breakfast. I worked at the book, being much hampered by a bad cold. Crawfurd Inge went into Durham with Ernest, to see the Cathedral.

I received a letter from Edgeworth writing from Edgeworthstown, Ireland, telling me that my broad–casted sermon was 'distinctly heard & attentively listened to in the middle of Ireland'.Macdonald writes from Essex to say that there also they heard 'on our Loud Speaker as well as if you had been in the room'. It certainly is a most amazing invention, & carries great possibilities.
